BR_text.BRsummary: Docker build with Pyro dev, PyTorch master, and Python 2.7 fails
BR_text.BRdescription:
I was trying to build a Docker image from our dockerfile using make build pyro_branch=dev pytorch_branch=master python_version=2.7 and got the following error:
 <denchmark-code>Step 22/25 : RUN conda install -y python=${python_version} &&     conda install -y jupyter matplotlib
  ---> Running in d334a6741e9d
 Solving environment: ...working... failed
 
 UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
   - chardet -> python[version='>=3.6,<3.7.0a0']
   - python=2.7
 Use "conda info <package>" to see the dependencies for each package.
 
 The command '/bin/sh -c conda install -y python=${python_version} &&     conda install -y jupyter matplotlib' returned a non-zero code: 1
 Makefile:40: recipe for target 'build' failed
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text: I think the scripts possibly need updating to include mkl-devel but this looks unrelated. Will investigate and push out a fix.
